abstract_summ: We filter the number of cumulative reported cases and estimate model parameters and more importantly unreported infectious cases (asymptomatic and symptomatic infectious individuals).Observation model accounts for delays in reporting cases and deaths.To this aim, a machine learning approach based on particle swarm optimization (PSO) is proposed to automatically identify the model parameters based on a training set of data of progressive increasing size, considering Lombardy in Italy as a case study.For this purpose, a novel combination of Monte Carlo simulations, wavelet analysis and least squares optimization is applied to a known basis of SEIR compartmental models , resulting in the development of a novel class of stochastic epidemiological models with promising short and medium-range forecasting performance.Although this analytical model has been designed from a basic exponential growth model, the performance of the AAEDM is competitive with other Bigdata based simulation models.
title_summ: Covid19 infection spread in Greece: Ensemble forecasting models with statistically calibrated parameters and stochastic noiseAAEDM: Theoretical Dynamic Epidemic Diffusion Model and Covid-19 Korea Pandemic CasesDynamics of Transmission and Control of COVID-19: A Real-time Estimation Using the Kalman FilterA new design of an adaptive model of infectious diseases based on artificial intelligence approach: monitoring and forecasting of COVID-19 epidemic casesAn SEIARD epidemic model for COVID-19 in Mexico: mathematical analysis and state-level forecastMonitoring and Tracking the Evolution of a Viral Epidemic Through Nonlinear Kalman Filtering: Application to the Covid-19 CaseEstimation Of State Variables And Model Parameters For The Evolution Of COVID-19In The City Of Rio de JaneiroMonitoring and forecasting the number of reported and unreported cases of the COVID-19 epidemic in Brazil using Particle FilterA mathematical epidemic model using genetic fitting algorithm with cross-validation and application to early dynamics of COVID-19 in AlgeriaSimulation of Covid-19 epidemic evolution: are compartmental models really predictive?A data driven analysis and forecast of an SEIARD epidemic model for COVID-19 in Mexico
title_abstract_phrases: We filter the number of cumulative reported cases and estimate model parameters and more importantly unreported infectious cases (asymptomatic and symptomatic infectious individuals).Observation model accounts for delays in reporting cases and deaths.An SEIARD epidemic model for COVID-19 in Mexico: mathematical analysis and state-level forecastWe propose an SEIARD mathematical model to investigate the current outbreak of coronavirus disease (COVID-19) in Mexico.For this purpose, a novel combination of Monte Carlo simulations, wavelet analysis and least squares optimization is applied to a known basis of SEIR compartmental models , resulting in the development of a novel class of stochastic epidemiological models with promising short and medium-range forecasting performance.Although this analytical model has been designed from a basic exponential growth model, the performance of the AAEDM is competitive with other Bigdata based simulation models.
